docs.title: RAG Notes
docs.text: A repository for documenting project notes and maintaining learning documentation using MkDocs.

docs.title: Initial Setup (One-time)
docs.text:
From your terminal, initialize the project with uv:

uv init rag-notes --no-package

Navigate into the project:

cd rag-notes

Now you're in: ~/RAGprojects/rag-notes

Add MkDocs dependencies:

uv add mkdocs mkdocs-material

Initialize the MkDocs structure:

uv run mkdocs new .

docs.title: Theme Configuration (mkdocs.yml)
docs.text:
Your project's appearance is controlled by mkdocs.yml in the root directory (~/RAGprojects/rag-notes/mkdocs.yml):

site_name: RAG Notes
theme:
  name: material

The theme: name: material uses the Material for MkDocs theme, which provides a clean, modern design.

docs.title: Customizing the Theme
docs.text:
You can customize the Material theme by adding options under the theme section. Common customizations:

Enable dark mode toggle:

theme:
  name: material
  palette:
    - scheme: light
      toggle:
        icon: material/brightness-7
        name: Dark mode
    - scheme: dark
      toggle:
        icon: material/brightness-4
        name: Light mode

Change site title and add a logo:

site_name: RAG Notes
site_url: https://github.com/kbhatiya999/rag-notes

theme:
  name: material
  logo: path/to/logo.png

After editing mkdocs.yml, save and restart uv run mkdocs serve --livereload to see changes.

For more Material theme options, visit Material for MkDocs documentation.

docs.title: Pushing to GitHub (Optional)
docs.text:
Your local repository already exists (created by uv init). First, commit all your changes:

git add .
git commit -m "Initial commit: setup rag-notes repo with MkDocs and Material theme"

Then, create a remote repository on GitHub and push your code using gh (GitHub CLI):

gh repo create rag-notes --source=. --remote=origin --push --public

Replace --public with --private if you want a private repository.

This will: - Create a new repository on GitHub - Connect your local repo to this remote (origin) - Push all your local commits to GitHub

Verify the connection:

git remote -v

You should see your GitHub repo URL listed. Your repo is now live at https://github.com/<your-username>/rag-notes.

docs.title: Pushing Future Changes
docs.text:
After your initial setup, to push changes to GitHub:

git add .
git commit -m "Your commit message here"
git push

Or as a shorthand:

git add . && git commit -m "Your message" && git push

docs.title: Deploying to GitHub Pages (Free Hosting)
docs.text:
Host your docs for free using GitHub Pages. First, update mkdocs.yml with:

site_url: https://<your-username>.github.io/rag-notes/
repo_url: https://github.com/<your-username>/rag-notes
repo_name: rag-notes

Then deploy:

uv run mkdocs gh-deploy

This builds your site and pushes it to the gh-pages branch on GitHub. Your docs are now live at:

https://<your-username>.github.io/rag-notes/

Note: The first deployment may take a few minutes. Refresh the link after a couple of minutes.

docs.title: Updating GitHub Pages After Changes
docs.text:
After you make changes and push to GitHub:

git add .
git commit -m "Update docs"
git push
uv run mkdocs gh-deploy

Or combine into one command:

git add . && git commit -m "Update docs" && git push && uv run mkdocs gh-deploy

docs.title: Running Locally (Daily Workflow)
docs.text:
In your project directory (~/RAGprojects/rag-notes), start the documentation server with live reload:

uv run mkdocs serve --livereload

The --livereload flag automatically refreshes your browser whenever you save changes to files in docs/.

Visit http://127.0.0.1:8000 to preview your docs locally.

docs.title: Exposing Publicly with Localtunnel (Optional)
docs.text:
First, install localtunnel (one-time):

brew install localtunnel

In a new terminal (keep uv run mkdocs serve --livereload running in your original terminal), expose your local server:

lt --port 8000

This outputs a public URL like https://quick-clouds-peel.loca.lt that anyone can access.

To retrieve your tunnel password: Visit https://loca.lt/mytunnelpassword — this shows the password people need to view your public docs.

docs.title: Building for Production (Optional)
docs.text:
When ready to deploy your docs, build the static site in your project directory (~/RAGprojects/rag-notes):

uv run mkdocs build

This generates a static website in the site/ directory that you can host on any web server.
